{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3348766,"name":"Charlie","username":"Shadowwolf1115","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/87869e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T01:15:46.277Z","cooked":"

How do I wire 2 RSL‚Äôs to the robo rio when there is only 1 port?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-04-01T01:15:46.277Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":25,"reads":361,"readers_count":360,"score":197.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460845,"topic_slug":"how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio","display_username":"Charlie","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65547,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio/460845/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3348767,"name":"Cody Wellman","username":"Zagdrath","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zagdrath/{size}/162012_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T01:19:18.718Z","cooked":"

You can use WAGO lever nuts. Just connect two RSLs to the port. Splice the wires together.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-04-01T01:19:18.718Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":354,"readers_count":353,"score":95.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460845,"topic_slug":"how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio","display_username":"Cody Wellman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48440,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3602A/M, 10505M | FiM FTAA/CSA"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio/460845/2","custom_user_title":"3602A/M, 10505M | FiM FTAA/CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348772,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T01:32:05.441Z","cooked":"

This is what I‚Äôd do, personally. You could also play with a servo Y-cable, if those reach. But usually they‚Äôll be a little short for the job, so you‚Äôre probably splicing wires regardless.

(I haven‚Äôt really explored this, as the rules only call for it to meet the criteria for one side of the robot and we have enough fish to fry. But I‚Äôm not going to knock it for others that want to style and profile.)

On 1672 when we ran dual RSL we used a PWM splitter spliced with two longer PWM cables to reach the top of the robot where the RSLs were located.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-04-01T01:47:12.569Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":269,"readers_count":268,"score":68.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460845,"topic_slug":"how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio","display_username":"Kiera Reed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/3-wire-pwm-y-cable-8-in","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":18}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52795,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"yfn rust fangirl"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio/460845/4","custom_user_title":"yfn rust fangirl","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348878,"name":"Quinton Rodgers","username":"Quint0n53","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/b782af/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T04:53:29.625Z","cooked":"

Depending on location you could probably just daisy chain them. From one light, add an extra ground and power running back out

Disclaimer. I have no idea if this is legal or even electrically stable. I just thought of it randomly

Edit: Daisy chain is actually what I meant. Thank you @Peter_Johnson

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-04-01T05:23:59.084Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460845,"topic_slug":"how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio","display_username":"Quinton Rodgers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57681,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7757 Alumni/4476 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio/460845/5","custom_user_title":"7757 Alumni/4476 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348883,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T05:12:16.055Z","cooked":"

That‚Äôs still wiring in parallel (power-power-power, ground-ground-ground), just daisy-chained. That‚Äôs fine and legal. Actually wiring them in electrical series is not.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-04-01T05:12:16.055Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460845,"topic_slug":"how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57681,"username":"Quint0n53","name":"Quinton Rodgers","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/q/b782af/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/how-do-i-wire-2-rsls-to-the-robo-rio/460845/6","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348898,"name":"Bodi","username":"IthcyPrince","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/dc4da7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-01T05:54:35.348Z","cooked":"

We ran two RSL‚Äôs this year and last year and I soldered custom Y cables for both years and never had an issue. The nice thing about doing that is you can have only one pair of wires for any length, then split off whenever is most convenient. For example, last year we ran only one pair of wires from the RIO to our elevator where our RSL‚Äôs were located, then split the wires where it was convenient on the elevator.
